**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**
CephFilesystem does not remove from kubernetes when ceph is unable to create it in the first place
**Expected behavior:**
CephFilesystem being able to finalize delete, even if fs doesn't exist on ceph
**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
<!-- Please let us know any circumstances for reproduction of your bug. -->

I was setting up CephFilesystem according to docs, applied the first config, the pods did not come up.
So I checked the operator logs:
`ceph-file-controller: failed to reconcile failed to create filesystem "myfs": failed to create filesystem "myfs": failed to create metadata pool "myfs-metadata": failed to create replicated pool myfs-metadata. Error ERANGE:  pg_num 32 size 3 would mean 752 total pgs, which exceeds max 750 (mon_max_pg_per_osd 250 * num_in_osds 3)`

So then I did a delete of the applied config, then these errors showed up in operator:
`ceph-file-controller: failed to reconcile failed to delete filesystem "myfs". : failed to get filesystem "myfs": failed to get file system myfs: exit status 2`

I then tried to apply with lower replica set to circumvent the max_pg, but no difference, same error logs.

Temporary fix provided by @travisn :
`kubectl -n rook-ceph edit cephfilesystem myfs`
remove the finalizer metadata
then restart the rook-ceph-operator

**File(s) to submit**:

* Cluster CR (custom resource), typically called `cluster.yaml`, if necessary
* Operator's logs, if necessary
* Crashing pod(s) logs, if necessary

 To get logs, use `kubectl -n <namespace> logs <pod name>`
When pasting logs, always surround them with backticks or use the `insert code` button from the Github UI.
Read [Github documentation if you need help](https://help.github.com/en/articles/creating-and-highlighting-code-blocks).

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): ubuntu 1804
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): Linux k-ash-01 4.15.0-106-generic #107-Ubuntu SMP Thu Jun 4 11:27:52 UTC 2020 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration: E3 xeon 128gb ram 1nmve 1ssd node x3
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): 1.3.6
* Storage backend version (e.g. for ceph do `ceph -v`): ceph version 14.2.9 (581f22da52345dba46ee232b73b990f06029a2a0) nautilus (stable)
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"18", GitVersion:"v1.18.4", GitCommit:"c96aede7b5205121079932896c4ad89bb93260af", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2020-06-17T11:33:59Z", GoVersion:"go1.13.9", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift):
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/rook/master/ceph-toolbox.html)): HEALTH_OK
title: CephFilesystem does not finalize deleting when it's not created on ceph
